Ways to Save Tax

Ways to Save Tax

Tax Saving Tips:

  • Invest in tax-saving mutual funds like ELSS (Equity Linked Savings Scheme).
  • Claim deductions under Section 80C by investing in PPF, NSC, or paying life insurance premiums.
  • Buy health insurance to avail of deductions under Section 80D.
  • Use the home loan interest deduction under Section 24(b).
  • Contribute to the National Pension System (NPS) for additional deductions under Section 80CCD(1B).
  • Donate to recognized charities to claim deductions under Section 80G.
  • Invest in tax-free bonds for tax-exempt interest income.

Examples of Billionaires Saving Taxes:

  • Warren Buffett: He maximizes charitable contributions through foundations, allowing him to reduce taxable income significantly.
  • Elon Musk: Utilized stock options, which are taxed at a lower capital gains rate, instead of receiving a large salary that would be taxed at a higher rate.
  • Jeff Bezos: Structured his investments to focus on capital appreciation, which is taxed less than ordinary income. He also borrowed against his stock holdings, avoiding capital gains taxes.
  • Mark Zuckerberg: Donated appreciated Facebook stock to his philanthropic LLC, avoiding capital gains tax and receiving a deduction for the full market value of the shares.
  • Bill Gates: Uses the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to donate large amounts of Microsoft stock, avoiding capital gains taxes and reducing taxable income through charitable deductions.
  • Larry Ellison: Leveraged loans against his Oracle stock to fund his lifestyle, which helps him avoid selling the stock and incurring capital gains taxes.
